thread.title: Wesley Sneijder wanted by Beijing Guoan and other unnamed Chinese Super League club but may reject mega-money move
thread.title_full: Wesley Sneijder wanted by Beijing Guoan and other unnamed Chinese Super League club but may reject mega-money move

author: arichardson
title: Wesley Sneijder wanted by Beijing Guoan and other unnamed Chinese Super League club but may reject mega-money move

organizations.name: beijing gouan news group newspapers ltd

text:
EFL wes he going? Wesley Sneijder wanted by Beijing Guoan and other unnamed Chinese Super League club but may reject mega-money move 
Despite obvious financial gain of move to Far East, Galatasaray midfielder may want to stay and fight for third Super Lig title By ANDREW RICHARDSON WESLEY SNEIJDER is the latest top European name wanted by a Chinese Super League club. 
Voetbal International claim Beijing Guoan and another unnamed club are courting the 32-year-old Dutchman. Getty Images 6 Wesley Sneijder has an offer from Chinese Super League club, Beijing Guoan 
Sneijder has been at Galatasaray since leaving Inter Milan in 2013, and his contract runs out at the end of next season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chinese Super League news, gossip and transfers 
Should he move to Beijing, he would link up with a former team-mate from the Turkish giants in Burak Yilmaz. 
While an offer to move to the Chinese Super League may be tempting financially, it remains unclear as to whether Sneidjer would be keen. 
However, Sneijder has been excellent at Galatasaray. VI Images/Press Association Images Wesley Sneijder has been excellent since joining Galatasaray back in 2013 Related Stories GREAT HAUL Shanghai new boy Oscar joins fellow big money signing Hulk as he settles into life in China YOU NOODLES Chinese players could decide who is the champion of the Super League - despite investing millions in foreigners Chery on top Huge blow for QPR as Tjaronn Chery set for £2.5million move to join Chinese Super League rich list Axel Witsel latest star to join world's top earners' list following big money move to China Big Ben's Beijing Bid Crystal Palace's Christian Benteke subject of £40million bid from Chinese side Beijing Gouan News Group Newspapers Ltd
